noun.description: A senior administrative officer in certain colleges and universities.
The head of a chapter in a cathedral.
(in Scotland) the civic head of some regional Scottish councils, analogous to a mayor in England, Wales, and Northern Ireland.
The chief magistrate of a French or other European town.

origin: Late Old English profost head of a chapter, prior, reinforced in Middle English by Anglo-Norman French provost, from medieval Latin propositus, synonym of Latin praepositus head, chief (see praepostor).
